author: timbeiko
content:
A few important notes out of the London Infrastructure Call:

0. We agreed to keep the gasLimit (and not target) in the block. We will reach out to miners directly to tell them to target a 2x'd gas limit on the fork block. We merged <@!543900561460822016>'s PR for this: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/commit/67d0d75f6393f6a109f2dc81cffc1e6541fb7aa3

1. We'll open a PR against 1559 to add the names of the JSON RPC fields to the EIP directly for clarity. No one volunteered to do that, though. <@!206016661470314496> <@!211091239112671234> given we agreed to go with your naming scheme, can either of you do it üòÑ ? 

2. For the rest of the JSON RPC changes, we'll spec the diff outside of EIP-1559. We can either use the eips repo (e.g. https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3041) or the eth1-specs repo where we're starting to move things over. Either option probably works, but we currently don't have anyone to do this. If someone wants to take this on, please ping me. **Funding is available for this.**

3. We'll also make a small PR to 1559 to only set the `BASE FEE` on the fork block vs. having the fork block treat its parent as having the starting base fee. <@!543900561460822016> will open a PR for this. 

4. For Baikal, there seemed to be some confusion in the client teams re: the included EIPs. The full list is: 

 EIP-1559 Commit Hash - 67d0d75f6393f6a109f2dc81cffc1e6541fb7aa3 (updated based on (0) above
 EIP-3198 Commit Hash - 081db1a6614e523dd791691cff7016e32c369912
 EIP-3529 Commit Hash - 6079eba5d1344a6b68075f79c14d4b7caf13ef53
 EIP-3541 Commit Hash - TBA

author: timbeiko
content:
In order to get to consensus on this fairly quick, what are the top suggestions for the JSON RPC names for maxPriorityFeePerGas, maxFeePerGas and baseFeePerGas? 

For the base fee, Abdel's EIPs used `baseFee` (https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3041). For the two other fields, `gasFeeCap` and `gasTipCap` were proposed and seemed to have _some_ consensus on, with a slight disagreement on the use of "Tip" (because it's not really optional). We could match the EIP with `gasPriorityCap`.

author: timbeiko
content:
Are people generally in favor of keeping `baseFee` as a the canonical name for the field? We could also do `baseFeePerGas` but that's more verbose.
